children.name: when a country, company etc is in a particular place
stand
children.definition: if abuildingorstructurestands somewhere, it is in that place:
examples: ▪ There is a parking lot now where the old school once stood.

children.name: stand in/near/on there etc
examples: ▪ The house stood next to a church.

children.name: be
children.definition: /bi, strong biː/ ở
examples: be in/on/near/there etc
ở trong / trên / gần / đó vv
▪ Egypt is in North Africa.
▪ The bank is on the next corner.
▪ Can you tell me where the station is?

children.name: be based
children.definition: if acompanyororganizationis based in a place, its main offices are there:được đặt trụ sở
examples: be based in/at
▪ The United Nations is based in New York.
▪ More than 200 aircraft will be based at Miramar Air Force Base.
London-based/Tokyo-based etc
▪ a London-based insurance company

children.name: be located
children.definition: /situated if a buildingis located/situatedin a particular street, town, or area, it is in that place. Be located/situatedis more formal thanbe.:được đặt ở
examples: be located/situated in/at/near/there etc
▪ The bookshop is located at 120 Charing Cross Road.
▪ A U.S. Air Force Base is located nearby.
▪ The Duke’s home is situated in an attractive part of central London.
conveniently/pleasantly/ideally situated
▪ a new hotel, conveniently situated close to the airport
conveniently/pleasantly/ideally located
▪ The two fisheries are ideally located between major markets in New York and Boston.

children.name: a place where sb usually often goes
sb’s place
children.definition: somebody’s place/ somebodyˈs ˈpleɪs/  the place where someone usuallysitsorstands, especially in a bar, at work, or in their home:
examples: chỗ ai đó
▪ Gerard was in his usual place by the fire when I reached the pub.
take your placesit or stand in a place where you usually sit or stand
lại chỗ của bạn
▪ The children took their places, and the teacher began calling the roll.

children.name: haunt
children.definition: a place such as a bar or park that sb likes to go to often, especially in order to meet people:nơi hay lai vãng
examples: Cafes like ‘Les Deux Magots’ were once the favourite haunts of French artists and intellectuals.

children.name: old hauntswhere someone used to go at another time in their life
examples: Johnson will be revisting all his old haunts in Washington.
This pub used to be one of youroldhaunts, didn't it Jim?

children.name: hangout
children.definition: informala place where a particular group of people, especially young people, often go to meet, talk etc:nơi lui tới thường xuyên
examples: In New York, try one of the celebrity hangouts, such as the Russian Tea Room or Elaine’s.

children.name: a teenage hangout on Fountain Street
examples: The café is a favourite hangout of artists.

children.name: hangout for
examples: The bar is a favorite hangout for soldiers from the nearby base.

children.name: when sth is usually kept in a place
belong
children.definition: / go especially spoken if somethinggoesorbelongsin a place, it should always be put there when it is not being used:
examples: Put everything back where it belongs when you’re through.
go/belong in/on/under etc
‘Where do these plates go?’ ‘They go in the cupboard above the sink.’
The books belong in the shelves, not on the floor.

children.name: its place
children.definition: its/their place the place where sth is normally kept or put:chỗ của nó/chúng
examples: ▪ The kids never put anything back in its place.

children.name: its/their usual place
examples: ▪ I can’t find the coffee tin -- it isn’t in its usual place.

children.name: out of place
children.definition: not in the correct or usual position :
examples: The kitchen was spotlessly clean, with nothing out of place.

children.name: in place
children.definition: in the correct position :
examples: The chairs for the concert were nearly all in place.
The glass washeld in placeby a few pieces of sellotape.
The chairs are all in place.
He screwed the shelf in place.

children.name: place
children.definition: a point or area, especially one that you visit or use for a particular purpose
examples: Make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
I’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
The place was full of screaming children.
He was threatening to burn the place down.
She had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
The theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
We were living then in a place called Alberiga.
The wall was quite dampin places(= in some places ).

children.name: a meeting place
examples: The club was a meeting place for musicians.

children.name: a hiding place
examples: He had watched the farm workers from his hiding place.

children.name: a resting place
children.definition: a place where someone or something stays or is buried
examples: This tomb is the last resting place of the Davison family.

children.name: sb’s place of birthformal
examples: I need to know his date of birth, and his place of birth.

children.name: sb’s place of work/employmentformal
examples: Please give the address of your place of work.

children.name: sb’s place of residenceformal
examples: By law, you must inform us if you change your place of residence.

children.name: sb’s/sth’s place of originformal
children.definition: the place where someone or something first came from
examples: I believe my mother's place of origin was Sierra Leone.

children.name: a place of safety
examples: His young son had been sent away to a place of safety.

children.name: a place of refuge
children.definition: somewhere safe to go or hide
examples: If ever you need a place of refuge, come to us.

children.name: a place of worship
examples: The church is much more than a place of worship.

children.name: a place of pilgrimage
children.definition: one that people visit because it is special, usually for a religious reason
examples: Her grave became a place of pilgrimage.

children.name: place for
examples: This is a great place for a holiday.
This would be a great place for a party!

children.name: a place to sit/eat/sleep etc
examples: Sign your name on the list, and find yourself a place to sit.
I was looking for a place to park the car.

children.name: right/wrong place
examples: Are you sure this is the right place? I don’t see Emma.

children.name: location
children.definition: slightly formal a particular place, especially in relation to other areas, buildings etc - used especially in business, advertising, or in official contexts: địa điểm
examples: its isolatedgeographical location
a new hotel in an attractive location
The time, date, and location of the conference have not yet been announced.
Authorities say they have pinpointed the location of the sunken ship.
in a good/ lovely/ etc location
The hotel isina lovely location overlooking the lake.
His apartment is in a really good location.
Register:Locationis often used when talking about buying, or selling property. In everyday English in other contexts, people usually sayplace:
It can be stressful moving to a newplace.

children.name: site
children.definition: 1a place where something important or interesting happened :
examples: an archaeological site
site of
The house is built on the site of a medieval prison.
the site of the air crash
2an area of ground where something is being built or will be built
site of/for
the site of a proposed missile base
a site for a new airport
building/construction site
He managed to get himself a job on a building site.
3a place that is used for a particular purpose :
acamping site
site of/for
a nesting site for birds

children.name: an archaeological site
examples: Archaeological sites are often discovered by accident.

children.name: a historic site
examples: There are numerous historic sites to visit.

children.name: an ancient site
examples: The organization maintains and restores ancient sites, castles, monuments etc.

children.name: a sacred site
children.definition: a place that is important in a religion
examples: Ayers Rock is the most sacred site of the Aborigines.

children.name: a burial site
examples: A Bronze Age burial site has been discovered.

children.name: the crash site
children.definition: where a plane etc crashed
examples: Wreckage was seen 200 metres away from the crash site.

children.name: a bomb site
children.definition: where a bomb has exploded
examples: the bomb sites of war-torn London

children.name: a building/construction site
examples: He has worked on various building sites.

children.name: a greenfield siteBritish English
children.definition: a piece of land that has never been built on
examples: We want to shift the balance of housing development from greenfield to brownfield sites.

children.name: a brownfield siteBritish English
children.definition: a piece of land that has been built on before
examples: The majority of the houses will be built on brownfield sites.

children.name: a camp/camping site
examples: First they had to look for a camp site.

children.name: a caravan site
examples: BrE: A well-run caravan site near the river brings holidaymakers into the village.

children.name: a landfill site
children.definition: where rubbish is buried
examples: Recycling reduces the volume of waste which goes into landfill sites.

children.name: an industrial site
children.definition: where factories are
examples: The area is to be redeveloped as an industrial site.

children.name: a missile site
examples: There were photos of a missile site under construction.

children.name: a nesting site
examples: Normally the male swan won’t let other swans near his nesting site.

children.name: spot
children.definition: rather informal a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time or live :
examples: a nice quiet spot on the beach
I chose a spot well away from the road.
holiday spotUK /vacation spotUS
Las Vegas has a growing reputation as an entertainment and vacation spot.
in a spot
a small cottage in an idyllic spot
on a spot
Why do they want to build a house on this particular spot?
spot for
an ideal spot for a picnic

children.name: venue
children.definition: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place : nơi gặp gỡ
examples: The hotel is a popular wedding venue.
sporting/conference/concert etc venue
The first thing to do isbookavenue.
The band willplay(= perform at )as manyvenuesas possible.
venue for
the venue for the latest round of talks
The restaurant is one of the few venues for jazz music in the area.
Ministers have not yet agreed on a venue for the next Conference on European Security.
the venue for the next Olympic Games

children.name: whereabouts
children.definition: the place where someone or something is – used especially when you do not know this or do not want to tell people :chỗ ở, nơi ở

children.name: sb’s whereabouts
examples: Trupin is thought to be in the Caribbean, although his exact whereabouts are/is a mystery.
The police received an anonymous tip about the suspect’s whereabouts.
Despite numerous searches and enquiries, her whereabouts are still unknown.

children.name: whereabouts of
examples: The police have appealed for information concerning the whereabouts of the stolen car used in the robbery.
They tried to torture him into revealing the whereabouts of the $90 million, but he didn’t know anything.

children.name: The whereabouts of the painting is unknown
somewhere
children.definition: used for talking about a place when you are not sure exactly which place :
examples: She came from somewhere in London.

children.name: when an object is in a particular place
be
children.definition: /bi, strong biː/ ở
examples: ▪ Do you know where my keys are?

children.name: be in/on/near/there etc
examples: ▪ The television is in the living room.
▪ Your supper’s in the oven.
▪ There’s a letter for you on the table.

children.name: stand
children.definition: /stænd/  to be in a particular place in an upright position:có ở
examples: ▪ The linoleum was dented where a washer and dryer once stood.

children.name: stand in/on/near/there etc
examples: A single tall candle stood in the middle of the table.
▪ A Christmas tree stood near the fireplace.

children.name: lie
children.definition: /laɪ/  to be in a flat position on a surface - use this about paper, clothes, books, or other things that can be placed flat:nằm ở
examples: lie in/on/near/there etc
▪ Several letters were lying on the table
.▪ The children’s clothes were lying all over the bedroom floor.
▪ Her packed suitcase was lying near the door.

children.name: spoken: where sb or sth is, where they are from etc
where
children.definition: /weəʳ/ ở đâu
examples: ▪ Where are you?
▪ This is where we keep all our junk.
▪ I can’t remember where I last saw it.
▪ Could you tell me where the nearest tourist information office is?
▪ Where are you going?
▪ Where did you buy those shoes?
where ... to
▪ Neighbours have no idea where the couple have moved to.
where to? spoken used to asksb where they are going
▪ ‘Would you like to come with us tonight?’ ‘Where to?’
where ... from
▪ Where did you get that magazine from?
where sb comes from
▪ In all that time Naomi never told me where she came from.

children.name: whereabouts
children.definition: especially spoken use this when you are asking in what general area sth is:nơi nào
examples: Did he say whereabouts he hid it?

children.name: ‘I’m from Thailand.’ ‘Whereabouts?’
examples: Whereabouts in Scotland is Perthshire?

children.name: where on earth
children.definition: / where in the world where - use this especially to show surprise or disapproval:ở đâu trên thế giới này
examples: ▪ Where on earth are you going dressed like that?
▪ We’ve been looking for you for hours. Where in the world have you been?
▪ When he woke up, he could not remember where on earth he was.

children.name: behind
children.definition: adverbPLACE
examples: in the placewhere someone or something was before
_I was annoyed to discover that I'dleftmy bag behind.( toi da buc minh khi thay rang yoi da de tui xach dang sau )
_After the party a few peoplestayedbehind to help clear up.

children.name: in
children.definition: adverbAT PLACE

children.name: at home or at work
examples: _When did you get home? I never heard you come in.
_Mr Ellis isn't in this week.

children.name: on site
children.definition: inside a factory, office building, etc.
examples: _There are two restaurants on site.
_The office complex has an on-site nursery.

children.name: out of place
children.definition: not suitable for a particular situation or occasion :
examples: He never seemed to feel out of place at social functions.
The paintings looked strangely out of place.
The boy looked uncomfortable and out of place among the adults.

children.name: the exact place where sth is or happens
position
children.definition: 1 the place where someone or something is, especially in relation to other objects and places
examples: She showed me the position of the village on the map.
I changed the position of the mirror slightly.
Jessica moved to a position where she could see the stage better.
position of
the position ofthe sun in the sky
Our hotel was in a superbcentral positionnear St Mark’s Square.
thestrategic position(= useful or important position )of Egypt in relation to the Arabian peninsula
2 correct place[C or U] the place where someone or something is needed or supposed to be
into position
He pulled the ladder into position.
in/out of position
All parking signs have now been placed in position.

children.name: point
children.definition: a particular place on alineor on asurface, especially a place that is used formeasuringdistances, heights etc:điểm
examples: The river at this point is half a mile wide.
Soon they came to a point where the road divided.
Ward Hill, at over 700 feet, is the island’s highest point.
At this point the path gets narrower. |No cars are allowed beyond this point.

children.name: spot
children.definition: rather informal the exact place where something is or happens:nơi, điểm
examples: People had left flowers at the spot where the police officer was killed.

children.name: the exact/very/same etc spot
examples: The museum sits on the exact spot where gold was first discovered.
She agreed to meet him at the same spot the next evening.

children.name: the exact spot where the king was executed
location
children.definition: the place where someone or something is, or where something happens.

children.name: your exact location
examples: The prisoners were taken to an undisclosed location.

children.name: location of
examples: A map showing the locationofthe property will be sent to you.

children.name: exact/precise locationwritten the exact place where something is or happens địa điểm chính xác
examples: The map shows theprecise locationof the crash.
The exact location of the ship, which sank in 1857, is being kept secret.
A military spokesman would not reveal the exact location of the search area.
Molecular biologists have found the precise location of the gene.

children.name: of
children.definition: prepositionPOSITION
examples: used in expressions showing position
_the top of his head
_the back of your dress
_on the corner of the street
_the front of the queue
_I've never been north ofEdinburgh.

children.name: setting
children.definition: nounPOSITION vị trí

children.name: scene
children.definition: the place where an accident, crime etc happened : hiện trường
examples: The police soon arrived atthe scene of the crime.
The police arrived to find a sceneofhorrifying destruction.
Evidence was found at the sceneof the crime.

children.name: at the scene
examples: Investigators are now at the scene, searching for clues.

children.name: on the scene
examples: Journalists were on the scene within minutes.

children.name: position
children.definition: C1 the place where people are sent in order to carry out a course of action:
examples: The troops took up their battle positions at the front line.
As soon as his officers wereinposition/had movedintoposition, the police commander walked up the path towards the house.
